description:
PEP 593 introduced the ``Annotated`` Type in Python 3.9, allowing typing
metadata. In 2023, usage of the type by popular libraries has
significantly increased. For example, ``FastAPI`` and ``Pydantic`` have
fully adopted the ``Annotated`` type and recommend it as the preferred
syntax for their functionality. In this talk, we will explore usage of
this type in open source projects and take a look at how it might be
used in your code.
title: What Is the `Annotated` Type?
